name: Pignic Pub & Patio
description: Pignic Pub & Patio is a beloved community gathering spot in Reno, built inside a historic 1916 craftsman home at 235 Flint St. The concept is unique: a community grill yard with charcoal grills, gas grills, and smokers where guests bring their own proteins to cook (or purchase locally sourced cuts on-site), paired with 28 craft beers on draft and creative cocktails. The outdoor space includes a fire pit, edible garden, and sun deck, while the cozy interior serves as a sports parlor with multiple TVs. The Revision Brewing Taproom occupies the second floor. Dog-friendly and family-friendly, with live music most weekends.
shortDescription: Community grill pub in a 1916 craftsman home with 28 draft beers, BYOB grilling, and live music.

faqs.question: What food does Pignic serve?
faqs.answer: Pignic specializes in slow-smoked barbecue including brisket, pulled pork, ribs, and creative sides.

faqs.question: Is Pignic good for large groups?
faqs.answer: Yes! The expansive patio with picnic tables and yard games is perfect for golf groups.

faqs.question: Is Pignic on the Truckee River?
faqs.answer: Yes, the patio overlooks the Truckee River, offering beautiful views especially during summer.
